item.title: Literacy, numeracy for referendums, elections
item.description: AS BANGLADESH prepares for both a national referendum and a parliamentary election in February 2026, the public conversation has largely revolved around electoral timelines, political alliances, and procedural logistics. These matters are important, but they obscure a more fundamental democratic question: are citizens sufficiently equipped to make informed political......News subscription service

item.title: Expectations and research imperative
item.description: RESEARCH has long been the quiet but decisive fault line separating universities that merely produce graduates from those that produce knowledge. In Bangladesh, higher education has traditionally leaned more towards teaching than inquiry, more towards classrooms than laboratories. Yet recent data suggest that this balance is slowly shifting, particularly within the......

item.title: India’s miscalculations and regional reset
item.description: BANGLADESH stands at a defining crossroads. With the close of Sheikh Hasina’s long and dominant political chapter, the country is entering an uncertain yet profoundly consequential phase. This transition is not merely a domestic political shift; it is embedded in the wider currents of South Asian geopolitics. From New Delhi to Washington, capitals are recalibrating......
